title.narrative: Transformative Investments for Energy Efficiency in Industries (TI4E) in Brazil

description.narrative: Industries are responsible for 33% of Brazil’s final energy consumption and 8% of greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions; energy intensiveness increases against global trends. The energy efficiency (EE) market is marginal due to end user-related barriers and limited capacity of the EE supply chain. The National Support Project (NSP) supports investments in EE by supporting the project identification and development, actual EE investments financed by public debt from the devlopment agency DESENVOLVE SP backed by a partial guarantee from the NAMA Facility and by enabling a pooling of EE projects for private sector refinancing. The NSP focusses on industrial Small & Medium Enterprises in the region of São Paulo, on thermal EE, developing the supply chain for EE and on financial institutions. It expects to mobilise EE investments of EUR 80m. Investments supported by the NSP are expected to directly avoid 7.267 GWh over their technology lifetime and mitigate emissions of approx. 1.1 MtCO2e.
